{{cpp/title|fputws}}
{{cpp/io/c/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cwchar|
int fputws( const wchar_t* str, std::FILE* stream );
}}

Writes every wide character from the null-terminated wide string {{tt|str}} to the output stream {{tt|stream}}, as if by repeatedly executing {{lc|std::fputwc}}.

The terminating null wide character from {{tt|str}} is not written.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|str|null-terminated wide string to be written}}
{{par|stream|output stream}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
On success, returns a non-negative value

On failure, returns {{lc|EOF}} and sets the ''error'' indicator (see {{lc|std::ferror}}) on {{tt|stream}}.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;cstdio&gt;
#include &lt;cwchar&gt;
 
int main()
{
    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_US.utf8");
    int rc = std::fputws(L"御休みなさい", stdout);

    if (rc == EOF)
        std::perror("fputws()"); // POSIX requires that errno is set
}
|p=true
|output=
御休みなさい
}}
